meanings.definition: The belief in or advocacy of the idea that all people should have equal rights and opportunities.
meanings.sent1: Universalism promotes the idea that everyone deserves the same chances in life.
meanings.sent2: In a society based on universalism, every individual is treated fairly and given equal opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The concept of universalism ensures that no one is left behind in the pursuit of justice.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to universalism shines through in her efforts to create a more inclusive community.
meanings.sent5: The principle of universalism stands as a beacon of hope for a more equitable future.

meanings.definition: The doctrine that all people will eventually be saved or reconciled to God.
meanings.sent1: Universalism teaches that all individuals will find salvation in the end.
meanings.sent2: The belief in universalism brings comfort to those seeking divine forgiveness.
meanings.sent3: At the heart of universalism lies the promise of eternal grace for every soul.
meanings.sent4: The concept of universalism offers solace to those questioning their place in the universe.
meanings.sent5: In times of doubt, the idea of universalism provides reassurance of a merciful deity.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being applicable or common to all members of a group or category.
meanings.sent1: Universalism ensures that rules are fair and apply equally to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The principle of universalism guarantees that rights are upheld for all members of society.
meanings.sent3: The beauty of universalism lies in its ability to create a level playing field for all.
meanings.sent4: In a world of universalism, no one is left out or overlooked in the pursuit of justice.
meanings.sent5: The essence of universalism is seen in the idea that equality should be universal and unchanging.
